ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basically all of statistics. Had none before, this was really helpful when I read primary literature.
I learned a lot about identifying the correct statistical tests for the situation at hand.

I have an improved understanding of biostatistics and have refreshed my knowledge about different statistical measures and how to best use them. However I did not gain a knowledge of SPSS from the lab portion of this class at all.
Basic statistical analyses for biomedical data. It was quite insightful.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoy the lectures a lot.

Strengths: very straightforward, professors asked questions to check understanding, material was relevant (mostly), not too much homework or reading Weaknesses: quite dry, but what do you expect for a statistics course? sometimes glossed over certain topics without giving explanation and used terms unfamiliar to newbies.
The course is appropriately paced. The labs could most likely be done independently with a TA walking around, instead of the TA walking us through it.

The lab portion was not useful at all - I have gained no knowledge of how to use SPSS and never used it to do the homework. At the beginning, the course was taught at a high school level as there were high school students in the first week fo the course. I liked the nightly homework assignments as they cemented the knowledge we reviewed in class.
It's a lot of information packed into a two-week course. Overall, it was a little much to be absorbed

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this to anyone who is interested in biostatistics.
Good for newcomers to statistics, especially in medical research. Nice that it was intensive to get it out of the way, and to learn all at the same time.
Yes. I thought that the course provided a good overview of biostatisticsal methods in a short-period of time.
I would because despite its flaws, the course helped me remember what I knew about statistics.
